Basic: Ah. Don't worry, I can fix that.
Oh well that was just un-cool.

Bucket: A pox! A pox unto you and your people!
I'll take a look at it in a second.
Aight, let's hit 'em back for twice as much.

Riggs: I uh... probably should have dodged that.

Johnson: Literally, or figuratively? I'll take either.

Bucket: Hey! Watch it! We've got precious cargo aboard!

Basic: Not bad, not bad... but you'll have to do a lot better than that.
Nothing like a few shots of the cannon to make a fish feel alive!

Bucket: Not good enough, though... gotta make them cry home to mommy!

Riggs: I love firing the gun! It makes me feel powerful...

Isaac: Woah, I think that one shook the ship.

Bucket: Yeah! Gotta love a good hearty impact.
Hey, good shooting, kid. You're a natural!

CAT: Violence is never the solution... except for when it is.

Bucket: Sick shooting Peri! I can really see where the combat training went.

Basic: Can't wait to harvest all their leftover scrap after this!
Had enough, or are you thirsty for more?

Dizzy: Okay, we really should get up more shields.

Bucket: Or maybe we just kill them faster.

Peri: Alright gang, now's our time to shine!

Bucket: You can't defeat me! I am a GOD amongst mortals!

Isaac: Alright, maybe dial it back a smidge.

Bucket: "Come on" what? What!? Tell me now so I don't gotta flexo-bust outta this armor and choke it out of you with my own two fins!
Can't die now. Gotta protect the baby.
Okay. Okay. I can still make this work.

CAT: Nothing we've never had to deal with before.

Basic: I hate armor... unless it's on us, of course.
Yeah, keep hitting our armor! See how far that takes ya!
Oh. Out of options. When'd that happen?
That's okay, didn't need that energy anyways.
Ooohohoo... So much stuff to tinker with!
One man's trash is another fish's treasure.
Can't wait to see what I can cook up with these babies.
Some extra junk lying around? No big deal.

EvilRiggs: And where do you think YOU'RE going?

Basic: Oh come on, just die already!
Maybe if this fight goes on long enough they'll die of boredom.
Oh hell yeah, now this is my kind of ship!
I HAVE A BUILT-IN COOLANT SYSTEM! ELEMENTS OF NATURE, DO YOUR WORST!!!
Man, dunno about you guys, but I sure am glad to be in a suit full of water right now.
Now to just sit back and let the ship do the steering.
I love having machines do my work for me!
Ah, the convenience of a self-flying ship...
Y'know, this sorta gives me the idea for an autopilot suit...
Hope that doesn't come back to bite us later.
I'll just put that over there...
Ack, lemme just pull off these extra bits.

Bucket: I will cave in your skull with my goddamn gorilla hands.
I'm gonna press in the soft spot on your head with my giganto-thumbs.

George: Soon, you'll be kicking the bucket!

Bucket: Oh my god that was so lame you're gonna make me cry.
It's thinking time, girls! Put on your thinking hats!

Riggs: Thinkin' outta my GOURD right now.

Bucket: Ah, finally got around to cutting off those useless extra bits on our shield generators. Should be much more efficient now.

Max: Okay? What do we do with the extra bits now, though?

Bucket: Finally, making some use out of all that wasted oxygen.

Basic: Don't ask me where I got these.
